module.name: Dialogs
module.short: Some dialogs commonly used in Lazarus applications. Look at the Procedures as well as the Classes

element.name: TMsgDlgType
element.short: Constants to define the types of message dialogs.

element.name: TMsgDlgBtn
element.short: Constants to define possible buttons on a dialog.

element.name: TMsgDlgButtons
element.short: Set of button messages for dialogs

element.name: mbYesNoCancel
element.short: A "set" constant to show a Yes, a No and a Cancel button on a messagedialog.
element.descr: A "set" constant to show a Yes, a No and a Cancel button on a messagedialog.

element.name: mbYesNo
element.short: A "set" constant to show a Yes and a No button on a messagedialog.
element.descr: A "set" constant to show a Yes and a No button on a messagedialog.

element.name: mbOKCancel
element.short: A "set" constant to show an OK and a Cancel button on a messagedialog.
element.descr: A "set" constant to show an OK and a Cancel button on a messagedialog.

element.name: mbAbortRetryIgnore
element.short: A "set" constant to show an Abort, a Retry and an Ignore button on a messagedialog.
element.descr: A "set" constant to show an Abort, a Retry and an Ignore button on a messagedialog.

element.name: MsgDlgBtnToBitBtnKind
element.short: A constant array used to convert the kind of message buttons to the kind of BitButton.
element.descr:
This array gives you for each possible button type in a messagebox the corresponding kind of BitButton.
For instance MsgDlgBtnToBitBtnKind[mbYes] has the value of bkYes.
It is the reverse of BitBtnKindToMsgDlgBtn.

element.name: BitBtnKindToMsgDlgBtn
element.short: A constant array used to convert the kind of BitButton to the kind of message buttons.
element.descr: This array gives you for each BitButton the corresponding type of button on a message dialog. For instance BitBtnKindToMsgDlgBtn[bkOK] has the value of mbOK. It is the reverse if MsgDlgBtnToBitBtnKind.

element.name: TCommonDialog
element.short: TCommonDialog: the base type from which other dialogs are derived
element.descr:
TCommonDialog: the base type from which all other dialogs are derived.
Use the "Create" method to make an instance of the dialog,
the "Execute" method to show it to the user
and the "Close" method to release it and free the used resources.

element.name: TCommonDialog.DoExecute
element.short: The function that actually takes care of executing the dialog

element.name: TCommonDialog.DoExecute.Result
element.short: Returns True if the correct exit button was pressed

element.name: TCommonDialog.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for dialogs

element.name: TCommonDialog.Create.TheOwner
element.short: The owner of the dialog: the component that called it

element.name: TCommonDialog.Execute
element.short: A public method of a dialog showing the appropriate dialog.
element.descr:
Use the execute method of a dialog to show it
and then check the result to see if the user made a valid choice and pressed the OK button.

element.name: TCommonDialog.Execute.Result
element.short: Returns True if the user pressed the OK button

element.name: TCommonDialog.Close
element.short: Close the dialog and return the memory used

element.name: TCommonDialog.DoShow
element.short: the procedure that actually takes care of showing the dialog box

element.name: TCommonDialog.DoClose
element.short: The procedure that actually closes the dialog

element.name: TCommonDialog.OnClose
element.short: Event Handler for closing the dialog

element.name: TCommonDialog.OnCanClose
element.short: Event Handler when dialog is able to be closed

element.name: TCommonDialog.OnShow
element.short: Event handler for showing the dialog

element.name: TCommonDialog.HelpContext
element.short: HelpContext - an index to the context-dependent help message for this dialog

element.name: TCommonDialog.Width
element.short: The width of th edialog box

element.name: TCommonDialog.Height
element.short: The height of the dialog box

element.name: TCommonDialog.Title
element.short: The Title or Caption to be shown at the top of the dialog box

element.name: TFileDialog
element.short: TFileDialog: allows selection of a file from the current directory.

descr.p: TFileDialog: allows selection of a file from the current directory.
This is also the base class for the Open and Save (As) dialogs

element.name: TFileDialog.DoExecute
element.short: Internal procedure called to execute the dialog.

element.name: TFileDialog.Execute
element.short: Public method which causes the dialog to be shown.

element.name: TFileDialog.Files
element.short: Stringlist which stored the selected files.

element.name: TFileDialog.DefaultExt
element.short: Sets the default file extension for the file dialog box.

element.name: TFileDialog.FileName
element.short: String to store the name of the file chosen by the user.

element.name: TFileDialog.Filter
element.short: A string which contains possible filename filters (eg .doc, .xmp, .pas etc).
element.descr:
This is a string which contains the filters a user can choose from.
The available filters and their description are separated by pipe symbols.
To set this property during runtime assign a value like: "All files|*.*|Lazarus Project files|*.lpr"

element.name: TFileDialog.FilterIndex
element.short: This property sets which file filter is the default.
element.descr: This property sets which file filter is the default. For example, set this property to 2 to set the second filter as default.

element.name: TFileDialog.InitialDir
element.short: Set the directory the dialog shows on opening.

element.name: TFileDialog.OnHelpClicked
element.short: Event handler when the Help button is clicked

element.name: TFileDialog.OnTypeChange
element.short: Event Handler when the selected file type is changed

element.name: TOpenOption
element.short: A list of possible options which can be used in OpenDialog

element.name: TOpenOptions
element.short: Set of TOpenOption

element.name: TOpenDialog
element.short: TOpenDialog: open a file in the current directory, selected by File Dialog.
element.descr:
TOpenDialog: open a file in the current directory, selected by File Dialog.
If the required file is not in the current directory, another directory can be selected with Select Directory

element.name: TOpenDialog.CheckFile
element.short: A protected function which checks if the chosen file meets all requirements.

element.name: TOpenDialog.CheckAllFiles
element.short: A protected method which calls CheckFile for each selected file.

element.name: TOpenDialog.DoExecute
element.short: Internal procedure called to execute the dialog.

element.name: TOpenDialog.Options
element.short: Options to be used for this dialog
element.descr: Options to be used for the Open File dialog. A full list of available options is found in

element.name: TOpenDialog.OnFolderChange
element.short: Event triggered when the user changes the folder in the OpenDialog.
element.descr:
This event is called when the user changes the folder (directory) in the OpenDialog.
Note: changing the folder will also trigger the OnSelectionChange event.

element.name: TOpenDialog.OnSelectionChange
element.short: Event triggered when the user changes the selection made in the OpenDialog.
element.descr:
This event is triggered when the user changes the selected file in the OpenDialog.
Note: When the user changes the folder OnSelectionChange will be called first.

element.name: TSaveDialog
element.short: Dialog for saving the current buffer to a file

element.name: TSelectDirectoryDialog
element.short: Select Directory Dialog
element.descr: Select Directory Dialog: allows the user to select a directory when the directory structure is displayed as a tree.

element.name: TColorDialog
element.short: Colour Dialog
element.descr:
Colour Dialog: presents a palette of colours to allow the user to select the required colour for text or graphics.
Call the Execute function to show the color dialog.

element.name: TColorDialog.FColor
element.short: Internal property to store the value of the chosen color.

element.name: TColorDialog.Create
element.short: The method whoch create an instance of the TColorDialog.

element.name: TColorDialog.Title
element.short: The caption for the color dialog.
element.descr: You can set the caption of the color dialog by changing this property.

element.name: TColorDialog.Color
element.short: A published property which reads en sets the FColor property
element.descr: When the Color dialog has been shown and the user pressed OK, the FColor property contains the chosen color.

element.name: TColorButton
element.short: Colour Button
element.descr: Colour Button: Pressing this button causes the Colour Dialog to be presented, allowing a choice of colour for text or graphics.

element.name: TFontDialogOption
element.short: An enumerated list of constants to set the options of a Font dialog.

element.name: TFontDialogOptions
element.short: A set of options for font dialogs

element.name: TFontDialog
element.short: Font Dialog
element.descr: Font Dialog: opens a dialog allowing choice of a font for textual displays

element.name: TFontDialog.SetFont
element.short: A private method which sets the font of the dialog.

element.name: TFontDialog.Create
element.short: Public method to create a FontDialog.

element.name: TFontDialog.Title
element.short: Specifies the caption of the dialog.

element.name: TFontDialog.Font
element.short: Property to store the chosen font.

element.name: TFontDialog.Options
element.short: A set of options available from TFontDialogOptions

element.name: TFontDialog.PreviewText
element.short: The text displayed in the preview pane of the dialog.
element.descr:
As a standard, the preview plane of the dialog
shows all letters both in uppercase and lowercase.

element.name: TFindOption
element.short: A list of possible options which can be used in Find-dialogs.
element.descr: A list of possible options which can be used in Find-dialogs.

element.name: TFindOption.frDown
element.short: If set the "Down" radiobutton is selected.

element.name: TFindOption.frFindNext
element.short: This option will be set when the user presses "Find Next"

element.name: TFindOption.frHideMatchCase
element.short: If set the "Match case" checkbox is hidden from the Find dialog

element.name: TFindOption.frHideWholeWord
element.short: If set the "Whole word" checkbox is hidden from the Find dialog

element.name: TFindOption.frHideUpDown
element.short: If set the "Up" and "Down" radiobuttons are hidden from the Find dialog

element.name: TFindOption.frMatchCase
element.short: This flag is set when the user checks the "Match case" checkbox.

element.name: TFindOption.frDisableMatchCase
element.short: If set the "Match case" checkbox is disabled in the Find dialog

element.name: TFindOption.frDisableUpDown
element.short: If set the "Up" and "Down" radiobuttons are disabled in the Find dialog

element.name: TFindOption.frDisableWholeWord
element.short: If set the "Whole word" checkbox is disabled in the Find dialog

element.name: TFindOption.frReplace
element.short: This flag is set if only the first occurence of the search string is to be replaced with the replace string.

element.name: TFindOption.frReplaceAll
element.short: This flag is set if all occurences of the search string are to be replaced with the replace string.

element.name: TFindOption.frWholeWord
element.short: This flag is set when the user checks the "Whole word" checkbox.

element.name: TFindOption.frShowHelp
element.short: If set the dialog will display a help button.

element.name: TFindOptions
element.short: A set of TFindOption

element.name: TFindDialog
element.short: A dialog used for finding text within the current editor or text buffer
element.descr:
Opens a dialog box allowing the user to enter text for searching, for example in a text editor.
As TFindDialog is the parent class for the TReplaceDialog,
it contains definitions for the Replace method,
but the Replace option does not actually appear when the dialog is displayed:
you need to use TReplaceDialog to do that

element.name: TReplaceDialog
element.short: A dialog allowing the user to replace text
element.descr:
The dialog appears and offers boxes for the user to enter text for searching and text to replace it,
for example while editing a file or large piece of text.
A number of buttons appear, offering the choice to replace this instance, find next, replace all

element.name: TCustomPrinterSetupDialog
element.short: Base class for TPrinterSetupDialog and TPageSetupDialog.

element.name: TPrintRange
element.short: Type of range of pages to print.

element.name: TPrintRange.prAllPages
element.short: Print all pages.

element.name: TPrintRange.prSelection
element.short: Print the selected range of pages.

element.name: TPrintRange.prPageNums
element.short: Print the selection of individual pages.

element.name: TPrintRange.prCurrentPage
element.short: Print the current page.

element.name: TPrintDialogOption
element.short: A list of available options for print dialogs

element.name: TPrintDialogOptions
element.short: A set of options for the print dialog

element.name: TCustomPrintDialog
element.short: Base class for TPrintDialog.

element.name: MessageDlg
element.short: Message Dialog
element.descr:
Show a message to the user and receive his response.
There are four versions of this function.
The first version displays a dialog with the standard caption,
the second, third and fourth versions enable you to set the caption.
The third version allows for a Default button;
the fourth version contains a help keyword instead of using context-based help.
If the first 'Caption' argument is missing, no caption is shown on the box.
This is the most complete and elaborate of the message dialogs,
and allows the programmer considerable control over the appearance of the dialog box.
The arguments defining the kind of box and its icon are types rather than integer constants,
and the buttons can be specified as a set in square brackets
eg [mbRetry, mbIgnore, mbAbort, mbCancel].
The HelpCtx argument allows the use of Context Help
The return value from the Function is the identity of the button pressed,
expressed as an integer (see the constant definitions in TControl
, [mrNone..mrAll]).

element.name: MessageDlg.Result
element.short: The result of this function is the button the user pressed to close the dialog.
element.descr:
The result of this function is the button the user pressed to close the dialog.
This is expresed as an integer

element.name: MessageDlg.aMsg
element.short: The message to be shown.
element.descr: The message shown to the user.

element.name: MessageDlg.DlgType
element.short: The type of dialog to be shown
element.descr:
The DlgType parameter indicates the type of dialog to show.
You can choose from
mtWarning, mtError, mtInformation, mtConfirmation or mtCustom.

element.name: MessageDlg.Buttons
element.short: Determines the buttons shown on the messagedialog
element.descr:
Buttons indicate which set of button captions have to be shown on the dialog.
You can choose from predefined sets:
mbAbortRetryIgnore,
mbOKCancel,
mbYesNo, mbYesNoCancel,
or you can make your own set.

element.name: MessageDlg.HelpCtx
element.short: HelpCtx is used to specify which topic from the help should be shown.
element.descr: HelpCtx is used to specify which topic from the help should be shown.

element.name: MessageDlg.aCaption
element.short: Used to set the caption of the messagedialog.
element.descr: Sets the caption of the messagedialog shown by this function.

element.name: MessageDlgPos
element.short: An extended MessageDlg function.
element.descr:
This function performs the same function as the MessageDlg
function.
It has been extended with parameters to place the dialog on a certain postion on the screen instead of in the centre of the screen.
The MessageDlgPos function does not enable you to choose the caption of the dialog.

element.name: MessageDlgPos.Result
element.short: The result of this function is the button the user pressed to close the dialog.
element.descr: The result of this function is the button the user pressed to close the dialog.

element.name: MessageDlgPos.aMsg
element.short: The message to be shown.
element.descr: The message shown to the user.

element.name: MessageDlgPos.DlgType
element.short: The type of dialog to be shown
element.descr:
The DlgType parameter indicates the type of dialog to show.
You can choose from
mtWarning, mtError, mtInformation, mtConfirmation or mtCustom.

element.name: MessageDlgPos.Buttons
element.short: Determines the buttons shown on the messagedialog
element.descr:
Buttons indicate which buttons have to be shown on the dialog.
You can choose from predefined sets:
mbAbortRetryIgnore,
mbOKCancel,
mbYesNo,
mbYesNoCancel,
or you can make your own set.

element.name: MessageDlgPos.HelpCtx
element.short: HelpCtx is used to specify which topic from the help should be shown.
element.descr: HelpCtx is used to specify which topic from the help should be shown.

element.name: MessageDlgPos.X
element.short: X specifies the position of the left side of the dialog
element.descr: X specifies the position of the left side of the dialog.

element.name: MessageDlgPos.Y
element.short: Y specifies the position of the top side of the dialog
element.descr: Y specifies the position of the top side of the dialog

element.name: MessageDlgPosHelp
element.short: An extended MessageDlgPos function.
element.descr: This function enables you to specify a Helpfile which has to be shown when the user presses F1.

element.name: MessageDlgPosHelp.Result
element.short: The result of this function is the button the user pressed to close the dialog.
element.descr: The result of this function is the button the user pressed to close the dialog.

element.name: MessageDlgPosHelp.aMsg
element.short: The message to be shown.
element.descr: The message shown to the user.

element.name: MessageDlgPosHelp.DlgType
element.short: The type of dialog to be shown
element.descr:
The DlgType parameter indicates the type of dialog to show.
You can choose from
mtWarning, mtError, mtInformation, mtConfirmation or mtCustom.

element.name: MessageDlgPosHelp.Buttons
element.short: Determines the buttons shown on the messagedialog
element.descr:
Buttons indicate which buttons have to be shown on the dialog.
You can choose from predefined sets:
mbAbortRetryIgnore,
mbOKCancel,
mbYesNo,
mbYesNoCancel,
or you can make your own set.

element.name: MessageDlgPosHelp.HelpCtx
element.short: HelpCtx is used to specify which topic from the help should be shown.
element.descr: HelpCtx is used to specify which topic from the help should be shown.

element.name: MessageDlgPosHelp.X
element.short: X specifies the position of the left side of the dialog
element.descr: X specifies the position of the left side of the dialog

element.name: MessageDlgPosHelp.Y
element.short: Y specifies the position of the top side of the dialog
element.descr: Y specifies the position of the top side of the dialog

element.name: MessageDlgPosHelp.HelpFileName
element.short: The Helpfile that has to be shown when the user presses F1
element.descr: The name of the helpfile to be shown when the user presses F1 in the dialog.

element.name: QuestionDlg
element.short: Show a question to the user and get a response
element.descr:
QuestionDlg has the same functionality as MessageDlg
except for the parameter Buttons which is of a different type.
You can define your own captions and return values of this function.
Buttons is a list of TModalResult (defined as constants [mrNone..MrYesToAll] in
) and strings.
For each TModalResult a button is created.
To set a custom caption, add a string after a button.
The default TModalResults defined in controls.pp (mrNone..mrLast)
doesn't need a caption. The default captions will be used.

element.name: QuestionDlg.Result
element.short: The result of this function is the button the user pressed to close the dialog.
element.descr: The result of this function is the button the user pressed to close the dialog.

element.name: QuestionDlg.aCaption
element.short: Used to set the caption of the question dialog.
element.descr: Set the caption of the question dialog shown by this function.

element.name: QuestionDlg.aMsg
element.short: The question to be shown.
element.descr: The question the user has to answer.

element.name: QuestionDlg.DlgType
element.short: The type of dialog to be shown in fact which icon will be shown.

element.name: QuestionDlg.Buttons
element.short: An array of return values and caption for the buttons on the question dialog.
element.descr:
Buttons is defined as a array of const.
This means you can define any number of buttons to be shown.
If your array consists of only predefined return values like mrOK and mrCancel,
the standard OK and Cancel buttons will be shown.
The strength of this function is however that you can fill the array like:
[400, 'Yes!!!', 401, 'Are you mad?', 402, 'My mistake'],
which will create a dialog with three buttons;
the captions of the buttons will be the strings given in the array.
The return value of the function will be 400, 401 or 402,
depending on whether the user clicked the 'Yes!!!', the 'Are you mad?' or the 'My mistake' button.

element.name: QuestionDlg.HelpCtx
element.short: HelpCtx is used to specify which topic from the help should be shown.
element.descr: HelpCtx is used to specify which topic from the help should be shown.

element.name: ShowMessage
element.short: Show Message
element.descr:
Procedure ShowMessage (const Msg: string);
The simplest message dialog: takes a simple string as argument,
displays it in a stereotyped box,
and waits for a mouse-click or enter-key event
before returning to the calling routine or program.
This is a modal procedure call,
that is the box is displayed, receives focus,
and does not relinquish focus until the OK box is clicked or otherwise selected.

element.name: ShowMessage.aMsg
element.short: A string constant containing the message to be shown.
element.descr: A string constant containing the message to be shown.

element.name: ShowMessageFmt
element.short: Shows a message assembled from a format string and an array of arguments.
element.descr:
This procedure is an extension to the ShowMessage
procedure. The parameters it takes are the same as the Format function.

element.name: ShowMessageFmt.aMsg
element.short: The format string

element.name: ShowMessageFmt.Params
element.short: The parameters to be inserted in the message.

element.name: ShowMessagePos
element.short: Shows a message box at a given screen position.
element.descr: Shows a message box at a given screen position.

element.name: ShowMessagePos.aMsg
element.short: A string constant which is the message to ne shown.

element.name: ShowMessagePos.X
element.short: The horizontal position of the messagebox.

element.name: ShowMessagePos.Y
element.short: The vertical position of the messagebox.

element.name: InputQuery
element.short: Use InputQuery to show a dialog box to get some input from the user

descr.p: Two versions of this function which displays a prompt and expects user input of textual data;

The first includes a MaskInput boolean argument
which determines whether the user input is masked out by asterisks in the text-input box
(like during entry of a password),
the second omits this property.

The text entered by the user is returned in the variable argument 'Value'. The function result is a boolean which returns TRUE if the OK button was pressed, or FALSE if the box was closed by any other mechanism (such as clicking the 'Close' icon on the top title bar).
Omitting the MaskInput argument is equivalent to setting it FALSE.

element.name: InputQuery.Result
element.short: Returns True of OK button was pressed, False if Cancel was pressed or abnormal exit
element.descr: Result is True if the user pressed OK or hit RETURN in the dialog box. If the user pressed Cancel or the dialog was closed without pressing a button the result will be false.

element.name: InputQuery.ACaption
element.short: The caption for the dialogbox

element.name: InputQuery.APrompt
element.short: The text asking the user for his input.

element.name: InputQuery.MaskInput
element.short: Determines if the dialog shows *s or the actual input.
element.descr: Set MaskInput to true if you want to hide the input and display asterisks.

element.name: InputQuery.Value
element.short: The value the user entered.
element.descr:
When the DialogBox is shown the text in the Editbox will be Value.
This string can be altered or amended by the user.
When ENTER is pressed or OK clicked, Value will be the (possibly amended) text from the Editbox.

element.name: InputBox
element.short: Displays a box with defined title and prompt, and expects user input in a text box

descr.p: . A default string can optionally be displayed in the text box. The user-entered or default string is returned as the function result.
If the user selects the OK button, the text in the text box is returned. If the user selects the Cancel button, the default string is returned.

element.name: InputBox.Result
element.short: The result of this function is the string the user entered in the editbox or the default string

element.name: InputBox.ACaption
element.short: The caption for the dialogbox

element.name: InputBox.APrompt
element.short: The text asking the user for his input

element.name: InputBox.ADefault
element.short: Default value for dialog box
element.descr: The value of the editbox in the dialog will have this value.

element.name: PasswordBox
element.short: Password Box
element.descr:
PasswordBox: a specialised form of the InputQuery.
The editbox on the dialog box will mask the input.
The only parameters are aCaption and aPrompt.
Behaves very similarly to the InputQuery function with MaskInput = TRUE;
the difference is that the password that was typed in is returned as the result of the function (like InputBox).

element.name: PasswordBox.Result
element.short: The string the user entered.

element.name: PasswordBox.ACaption
element.short: The caption for the dialog

element.name: PasswordBox.APrompt
element.short: A prompt to ask for the users input.

element.name: TSelectDirOpt
element.short: List of options available when selecting a directory

element.name: TSelectDirOpts
element.short: Set of directory selection options

element.name: SelectDirectory
element.short: A function that allows to user to select a directory.
element.descr:
This function will show a dialog which allows the user to select the required directory when the directory structure is displayed as a tree.
Under Windows the caption from the resulting dialog cannot be set, but the label above the directory tree will have this value.
There are two version of this function, the second one having the ability to indicate whether hidden folders should be shown as well.

element.name: SelectDirectory.Result
element.short: A boolean indicating if the user pressed OK.
element.descr: A boolean indicating if the user selected a directory and pressed OK.

element.name: SelectDirectory.Caption
element.short: A constant which sets the caption of the shown dialog.
element.descr: A constant which sets the caption of the shown dialog.

element.name: SelectDirectory.InitialDirectory
element.short: The directory the dialog should start in.
element.descr:
The directory the dialog should start in.
If a valid directory is given, the selected directory in the tree will be set to this directory.

element.name: SelectDirectory.Directory
element.short: A variable which on exit contains the selected directory.
element.descr: A variable which on exit contains the selected directory.

element.name: SelectDirectory.ShowHidden
element.short: A boolean constant indicating whether hidden folders should be shown too.
element.descr: A boolean constant indicating whether hidden folders should be shown too.

element.name: Register
element.short: Register the components used in the current application, so that they can be recognised
